jobs.title: 2D Interaction Designer
jobs.description:
Description of Position


Job title                  2D Interaction Designer

Location                 London, Brixton

Industry                  Enterprise Design Software (SaaS)

Employment Type 2-3 months full-time contract with option becoming permanent

Website                  www.gravitysketch.com

 

About Gravity Sketch
 

Gravity Sketch is a London-based startup that is shaking up the 3D design space and transforming the future of digital creation. Just like Adobe revolutionised 2D design, our vision is to revolutionise 3D design today. Backed by high profile VCs and investors from Silicon Valley, London and Tokyo, we are developing the first enterprise-grade immersive 3D design and collaboration software which allows designers, engineers, and other stakeholders to create remotely together, in real-time, across multiple devices and platforms. We aim to transform the future of digital creation through disrupting the current design and engineering workflows, placing the user at the center of the creation process. Our product is used by thousands of designers in industries such as automotive, apparel and film, across North America, Europe, and Asia.

 

Responsibilities
 

Following recent updates, which helps designers bridge the gap between 2D and 3D asset creation by enabling users to seamlessly work between tablets and VR, as well as share and collaborate in real-time on 3D assets, via our cloud solution -   we are now in search of an experienced 2D Interaction (UX) Designer, to work closely with to build functional, yet beautiful interfaces for our customers. 

The successful candidate will need to drive the prototyping and production of 2D web and tablet interfaces, in line with product pipeline. The candidate needs to have a user-centric approach to UX work and have strong user-engagement skills, constantly looking for innovative ways to engage with them to validate hypotheses. The 2D Interaction Designer will be comfortable working quickly and have excellent communications skills in order to accurately and efficiently share ideas with software engineers.  The successful candidate will work closely with the design and engineering teams to uphold the design principles of customer journeys between Gravity Sketch’s 2D apps and VR applications. 

 

Requirements

* A team-player and mediator with a humble, empathetic and can-do attitude and drive to continuously learn
* Open-mindedness to non-traditional solutions is essential
* Passionate about working in a fast-paced, disruptive technology industry 
Business-orientated mindset
* Strong ability to quickly generate wireframes, physical and digital prototype (Eg. InVision, Figma and Marvel)
* At least 2 years of UX experience in a technology (SaaS or product-driven) company or a reputable multidisciplinary  design agency 
* Experience leading and driving experience development across applications and devices
* User-centric approach to UX
* Experience working with Agile and Lean methodologies
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Work from  our Brixton (London) office 
 

What we offer

* Chance to work at a fast growing B2B SaaS startup
* Real work ownership - you drive your own initiatives
* Unparalleled learning, if you’re up for the challenge!
* Opportunities for growth and professional development
* Great work culture and environment - we work hard but also know how to have fun
* £1,000 annual professional development stipend (permanent only)
* 25 days paid holiday (+ bank holidays)
* Discounted local gym membership with weekly team sport days
* Cool studio based in Brixton, weekly team lunches, generous social budgets

We are committed to equality of opportunity for all employees. Applications from individuals are encouraged regardless of age, gender, background, and nationality.

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager
jobs.description:
Description of Position
Job title		Customer Success Manager 
Team			Customer Success
Reporting To		CCO
Location		London, Brixton with weekly travel to Germany
Industry		B2B Design Software
Employment Type	Full-time, Permanent 
Website		www.gravitysketch.com

About Gravity Sketch
Gravity Sketch is a London-based startup that is shaking up the 3D design space and transforming the future of digital creation. Just like Adobe revolutionised 2D design in the 80s, our vision is to revolutionise 3D design today. Backed by high profile VCs and investors from Silicon Valley, London and Tokyo, we are developing the first enterprise-grade immersive 3D design software which allows designers to create remotely together, in real-time, across multiple devices and platforms. We aim to transform the future of digital creation through disrupting the current design and engineering workflows, placing the user at the center of the creation process. Our product is used by thousands of designers in industries such as automotive, apparel and film, across North America, Europe, and Asia.

About the role

You’ll be the first boots on the ground in our German market, joining at an exciting time where you will be expected to own the customer success function across that market, whilst working closely with our CXO/Managing Director, Daniela. 

We are looking for a self driven & empathetic problem solver who is passionate about our customer base to help them achieve their business goals and to solve their problems through the use of Gravity Sketch. You will work with our customers and drive  the success planning to help them achieve their goals, across our German market, by building & fostering relationships with our clients. 

You  will be the voice of the customer within Gravity Sketch, and will advocate for your customers while working closely with the product team to ensure that our customer’s needs are reflected in the product roadmap. This is an exciting time to join the company - you will work closely with the Management team at Gravity Sketch to turbocharge our growth.

If you are passionate about technology & design, love finding and solving problems, and are the type of person who can find insights in any conversation then we want to hear from you!
 
Progression in the role
The Customer Success Manager role will provide you with insights across the business and give you the opportunity to help shape the strategy in all elements of the Customer Success function, as well as have an impact in the product and the customer experience and communication. 

We would see the successful Customer Success Manager becoming our Head of Customer Success, EMEA and build out their own team, if this is where their skillset and interests intersect. Over time, the successful candidate could grow into overseeing the global Customer Success function as VP of Customer Success. 
 
Responsibilities
Build long-term, strategic partnerships, from end-users to decision-makers, serve as a trusted advisor to executives & key stakeholders
Engage with your customers through regular calls and visits to understand their workflows, organizational structures, and overall requirements
Monitor and manage adoption metrics to ensure customers are utilizing Gravity Sketch at its full potential
Create success plans for your customers and document their progress towards established goals and results
Be the customers’ main point of contact to provide best practices and to help them achieve their goals through the use of Gravity Sketch products
Manage escalations closely, acting as the quarterback for all critical issues and ensuring multiple internal teams are aligned
Communicating major milestones and updates to Gravity Sketch’s management team on a regular basis
Work closely with multiple cross-functional teams, predominantly across the marketing and sales teams, by providing invaluable insight into the customer’s needs and challenges, helping influence and guide internal product road-maps, projects, product and services communications
Develop a deep understanding of Gravity Sketch to ensure proper implementation in every customer’s environment

Requirements 
2+ years in a client facing role, such as customer success, hospitality, or consulting, design research.
Ability & willingness to travel. The role would include significant travel between our HQ in London, and our clients in Germany. 
A natural communicator with otstanding relationship building skills and empathy for customers from all walks of life
Aptitude for strategic thinking and forward planning
Detail-oriented and organized, with extensive project management skills
Ability & experience in bridging qualitative and quantitative research 
Drive & motivation to succeed in a fast-paced & high-growth environment, product, and methodology
Open-minded approach with the ability to adapt and pivot if an approach or process needs to be changed
Demonstrated curiosity and self-driven motivation to learn from a wide spectrum of backgrounds and perspectives, and actively seeking out new methods of learning or new experiences
Exceptional problem-solving abilities, with experience in planning & leading research activities
A strong ability to translate and apply insights to inform both creative solutions and strategic decision-making

Bonus Points
A design background, either in university or through previous work experience
An experience in Design Research 
Experience in a consultancy, preferably a design consultancy
Experience in a hospitality role
To have lived abroad for 2+ years
Having worked with, or at, Salesforce

What we offer
Chance to work at a fast growing startup reimagining the 3D design workflow
Real work ownership - you drive your own initiatives
Unparalleled learning, if you’re up for the challenge!
Great work culture and environment - we work hard but also know how to have fun
25 days paid holiday (+ bank holidays)
Regular team building activities like five a side football and a weekly pub quiz
Cool studio based in Brixton with all the regular perks you would expect from a start up
£1,000 personal budget per year for professional development
Discounted local gym membership and regular team sport days

We are committed to equality of opportunity for all employees. Applications from individuals are encouraged regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, background, and nationality.

jobs.title: Account Executive
jobs.description:
Description of Position

Job title Account Executive

Location London, Brixton

Industry Enterprise Software

Employment Type Permanent, Full Time

Website www.gravitysketch.com

 

About Gravity Sketch

Gravity Sketch is a London-based startup that is shaking up the 3D design space and transforming the future of digital creation. Just like Adobe revolutionised 2D design in the 80s, our vision is to revolutionise 3D design today. Backed by high profile VCs and investors from Silicon Valley, London and Tokyo, we are developing the first enterprise-grade suite of immersive 3D design software which allows designers to create remotely together, in real- time, across multiple devices and platforms. We aim to transform the future of digital creation through disrupting the current design and engineering workflows, placing the user at the center of the creation process. Our product is used by thousands of designers in industries such as automotive, apparel and film, across North America, Europe, and Asia.

 

About the role

We are looking for an Account Executive to work together with the CEO to own the end to end sales funnel – from lead generation to deal close.

 

We would expect the successful candidate to bring new ideas to the table to develop and refine our enterprise sales strategy and process, build out the sales team, and close new deals. Initially, sales will be focused on the transport sector (e.g., automotive). Over time, this will expand to other industries including film, gaming, product design, apparel/fashion, architecture.

 

Given that this is a new product disrupting the market, the Account Executive will have to adopt a consultative, pathfinder approach to sales and establish the talk track / proposition towards each buyer persona, to ultimately turn a ‘nice to have’ into a ‘must have’ and help the buyer find budget for the product.

 

The Account Executive will ultimately be charged with helping the business to achieve ambitious customer acquisition targets in a scalable manner.

 

Responsibilities

● Working with the CEO to create and continuously improve a structured sales strategy and process

● Adopting a truly ‘hunter’ approach to lead generation with limited resources, by actively reaching out to prospects, attending industry trade shows, and working with marketing to plan and execute campaigns to grow top of funnel

● Driving the consultative sales process forward with a high sense of urgency to optimise sales cycle and success rates

● Conducting demos, customer workshops, and contract negotiations

● Helping to build out and keep the CRM up to date

● Manage a small team of SDRs

● Working with Customer Success to managing existing customer relationships

 

Requirements

● Excellent knowledge of consultative Enterprise software sales of £50-100k ACV

● Experience navigating unchartered sales processes – ideally at a Series A/B startup, or selling a new product in a more established company

● Resourceful, with the ability to have high impact without support structure (e.g. limited sales/marketing collateral, limited team support)

● Good structure and organisation, with strong attention to detail

● Not afraid to roll up sleeves and help out wherever needed - from admin work to picking up the phone

● Self-driven - to learn, to set targets, and able to work under limited supervision

● Enjoys learning and problem solving

● Great communicator - both written and verbal

● Great listening and relationship building skills

 

What we offer

● Chance to work at a fast growing startup reimagining the 3D design workflow

● Real work ownership - you drive your own initiatives

● Unparalleled learning, if you’re up for the challenge!

● Great work culture and environment - we work hard but also know how to have fun

● 25 days paid holiday (+ bank holidays)

● Regular team building activities like five a side football and a weekly pub quiz

● Cool studio based in Brixton with all the regular perks of a startup

● £1,000 personal budget per year for professional development

● Discounted local gym membership and regular team sport days

 

We are committed to equality of opportunity for all employees. Applications from individuals are encouraged regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, background, and nationality.

jobs.description:
Description of Position

Job title                  UX Designer

Location                 London, Brixton

Industry                  Enterprise Design Software (SaaS)

Employment Type Full time, permanent

Website                  www.gravitysketch.com

 

About Gravity Sketch

Gravity Sketch is a London-based startup that is shaking up the 3D design space and transforming the future of digital creation. Just like Adobe revolutionised 2D design, our vision is to revolutionise 3D design today. Backed by high profile VCs and investors from Silicon Valley, London and Tokyo, we are developing the first enterprise-grade immersive 3D design and collaboration software which allows designers, engineers, and other stakeholders to create remotely together, in real-time, across multiple devices and platforms. We aim to transform the future of digital creation through disrupting the current design and engineering workflows, placing the user at the center of the creation process. Our product is used by thousands of designers in industries such as automotive, apparel and film, across North America, Europe, and Asia.

 

Responsibilities

We are in search of an experienced and passionate UX Designer, who will work on web design flow and user journey flow for our cloud solution. 

You will research other cloud storage platforms and do user research with our customer base in order to build the best features into our cloud platform. You will work closely with our Web Developer to ensure that the user’s journey through our web app, LandingPad, is a great experience. 

You will have the opportunity to drive the prototyping and production of 2D web and tablet interfaces, in line with product pipeline. You will need to employ a user-centric approach to UX work and have strong user-engagement skills, constantly looking for innovative ways to engage with them to validate hypotheses. You will need to be comfortable working quickly and have excellent communications skills in order to accurately and efficiently share ideas with software engineers.  

You will work closely with the design and engineering teams to uphold the design principles of customer journeys between Gravity Sketch’s 2D apps and VR applications. Overtime, you will grow into a senior member of the design team, with the potential to grow into a Head of Design. 

 

Requirements

A team-player & mediator with a humble, empathetic, can-do attitude

A continuous drive to learn with a business-oriented mindset

Open-mindedness to non-traditional solutions is essential

Passionate about working in a fast-paced, disruptive technology industry 

Strong ability to quickly generate wireframes, physical & digital prototype (Eg. InVision, Figma, Marvel)

2+ years of UX experience in a technology (SaaS or product-driven) company or a reputable multidisciplinary design agency 

Experience leading and driving UX development across applications and devices

User-centric approach to UX

Experience working with Agile and Lean methodologies

 

What we offer

Chance to work at a fast growing B2B SaaS startup

Real work ownership - you drive your own initiatives

Unparalleled learning, if you’re up for the challenge!

Opportunities for growth and professional development

Great work culture and environment - we work hard but also know how to have fun

£1,000 annual professional development stipend (permanent only)

Flexible working hours to suit your schedule

25 days paid holiday (+ bank holidays)

Discounted local gym membership with weekly team sport days

Cool studio based in Brixton, weekly team lunches, generous social budgets

 

We are committed to equality of opportunity for all employees. Applications from individuals are encouraged regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, background, and nationality.
